author: Carlos Juárez
title: Rezan por lluvia en Tamaulipas, la sequía azota al estado | El Heraldo de México
text: La sequía y el calor sigue imperando en todo [Tamaulipas](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/5/8/ola-de-calor-tabasco-alcanza-temperaturas-de-44-grados-incendios-no-dan-tregua-601191.html), lo que ha obligado a los agricultores a tener que recurrir a Santos con la finalidad de que les hagan el milagro de que llueva lo suficiente para que las presas y las lagunas vuelvan a tener agua. En Altamira, en la zona rural del sur de Tamaulipas, los pobladores planean diversas actividades durante las fiestas patronales de San Isidro Labrador. También se tiene planeado recorrer las parcelas, para reforzar la “fe” en que se está manera se van a generar precipitaciones pluviales. Sigue leyendo: [Ola de calor: se esperan hasta 52 grados en Tamaulipas](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/5/8/ola-de-calor-se-esperan-hasta-52-grados-en-tamaulipas-601290.html) Se excavaran pozos El sistema lagunario del sur de Tamaulipas se encuentra a menos 24 centímetros en comparación con el nivel del mar. Incluso, el sector empresarial pide a las autoridades de los tres niveles de gobierno comenzar a perforar la tierra en busca de agua. El ingeniero Benito Torres, manifestó que la región cuenta con agua subterránea, y por ende debe de comenzar la perforación para crear pozos que doten de agua dulce a los hogares. Recordó que en Tampico y la región había hasta cuatro pozos de agua por colonia, sin embargo, se dejaron de utilizar debido a que se prefirió utilizar el agua. A la falta de lluvia se agrega la situación que impera con la ola de calor, ya que en Tamaulipas se han reportado temperaturas mayores a los 40 grados centígrados. Sequía en México El 67.97 por ciento del territorio nacional se encuentra en algún grado de sequía de acuerdo con el Monitor de Sequía de México, que realiza quincenalmente la Comisión Nacional del Agua juntos on el Servicio Meteorológico Nacional. Sigue leyendo: [¡Atención!: advierten por nueva y poderosa llamarada solar, ¿afectará en México?](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/5/9/atencion-advierten-por-nueva-poderosa-llamarada-solar-afectara-en-mexico-601484.html) El monitor arroja que han incrementando las zonas con sequía de extrema a excepcional en San Luis Potosí, Guanajuato, Querétaro y norte de Veracruz, de severa a extrema al norte de Puebla y de condiciones anormalmente secas en Jalisco, Colima, Michoacán y Guerrero. Por su parte, Tamaulipas tiene el 79 por ciento de su territorio en sequía,con cuatro municipios en una situación de sequía extrema a excepcional, y 26 en severa a extrema. LA

title: Пострадавшие сотрудники иркутской больницы находятся в тяжелом состоянии | Health | Seldon News
text: ИРКУТСК, 3 июл - РИА Новости. Две женщины - заместитель главного врача и секретарь больницы № 8 Иркутска, которых ранил ножом пациент, находятся в тяжелом состоянии, сообщает губернатор Иркутской области Игорь Кобзев. В городской клинической больнице № 8 Иркутска утром в четверг пациент напал с ножом и газовым баллончиком на медицинских работников. Мужчину задержали сотрудники полиции. Заведено уголовное дело о покушении на убийство двух лиц и более лиц. "Заместитель главного врача и секретарь учреждения госпитализированы в тяжелом состоянии. author: PTI
title: Tata Motors total domestic sales up 4 per cent to 76,138 units in December - The Week
text: Tata Motors, on Monday, reported a 4 per cent increase in its total domestic sales to 76,138 units in December 2023 as compared to 72,997 units in the same month a year ago. Passenger Vehicles (PV) sales, including electric vehicles, in the domestic market stood at 43,470 units last month as against 40,043 units in December 2022, up 9 per cent, the company said in a statement. Total electric PV sales were at 5,006 units last month as against 3,868 units in December 2022, up 29 per cent, it added. "For Tata Motors, CY23 was the third consecutive year of posting highest-ever sales of around 5.53 lakh units, led by its commanding position in the compact SUV segment and strong growth in hatches, despite the hatch segment degrowing at an industry level," managing director of Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles Ltd and Tata Passenger Electric Mobility Ltd Shailesh Chandra said in a statement. On the outlook, he said, "With multiple new products, including a new nameplate scheduled for launch in 2024, we remain optimistic about continuing the growth trend in the quarters ahead." Tata Motors said its total Commercial Vehicles (CV) sales in December 2023 grew 1 per cent to 34,180 units as compared to 33,949 units in the year-ago period. Tata Motors Ltd executive director Girish Wagh said going forward, the company expects demand to improve in the March quarter across most segments of the CV industry due to the government's continuing thrust on infrastructure development, the promising growth outlook of the economy "and our demand-pull initiatives".

title: BJP: Bjp Dividing Tribal Society On Religious Lines: Sarkar | Agartala News - Times of India
text: AGARTALA: After TIPRA Motha, former chief minister and CPM politburo member Manik Sarkar hit out at the BJP accusing it of creating division in tribal society on religious lines while criticising the move of Janajati Suraksha Mancha (JSM) to scrap ST benefits of converted tribals.Addressing party cadres here on Thursday, Sarkar said, “The rally JSM held two days ago was a new beginning to disintegrate tribals. The seeds of religious division are being sown in the tribal communities and innocent brothers and sisters living in the hilly areas are being misguided once again.”Slamming TIPRA Motha party for playing second fiddle to the ruling BJP in the recently held assembly elections, he said, “They (JSM) are not much different from TIPRA Motha. What happened in the last assembly elections, TIPRA Motha maintained a clandestine relation with the BJP and remained vocal against its policies in public.”Sarkar said TIPRA Motha, disregarding the attempts of opposition-fielded candidates in non-ST reserved seats, helped the BJP to win at least 20 seats and retain power. As the trick was exposed after the election results were declared, now the new slogan of religious incitement was raised to divide tribal society, he alleged.We also published the following articles recently Rights bodies oppose rally for delisting of converted tribalsCivil rights groups write letter to Jharkhand government, seeking vigilance and legal action against hate speeches at a rally organized by Janjanti Surakha Manch, an affiliate of RSS-backed Vanvashi Kalyan Kendra. The rally is demanding the removal of converted tribals from the Scheduled Tribes list. The groups allege that the rally is intended to create communal disharmony and divide tribals in the name of Sarna-Christianity. They express surprise at the government for granting permission for such a program.106243177 Party worried after Cong leader rallies against tribals delisting bidCongress faces challenge ahead of Lok Sabha elections as working president announces mega rally to counter bid to delist tribals converting to Christianity and Islam. Rally aimed at appeasing Christian tribals, but could upset tribal electorate who follow Sarna faith. State Congress insiders express concern over lack of consultation with JPCC's political affairs committee and working committee. JPCC working to tap into tribal voters to emerge from shadows of JMM. Former MLA Tirkey states rally not under party banner, invites like-minded tribal rights activist bodies. JPCC president Thakur states inability to comment on rally conducted on personal capacity.106335091 Tribals plan Delhi protest on delisting converts from ST listThousands of tribals from across India will converge in New Delhi in February to demand the removal of converted tribals from the ST list. The campaign is backed by the RSS and other Hindu groups. A recent rally in Ranchi, organized by the Janjati Suraksha Manch (JSM), saw 5000 tribals protesting against the social and financial advantages received by converted tribals. Supporters of de-listing argue that converted tribals receive support from foreign funds, reservation benefits, and government benefits as a religious minority. The JSM plans to hold the next rally in New Delhi, where tribals will demand reservation benefits for those who are genuinely deprived and following their traditional practices.106278286
